alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 23 at 9:43PM MST until August 23 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Southeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 1045 PM MST/1045 PM PDT/. * At 943 PM MST/943 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 23 miles southwest of Cibola to 6 miles north of Winterhaven to 8 miles southeast of Wellton, moving west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 41. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 51 and 96. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 46. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Brawley, Somerton, Gadsden, Fortuna Foothills, Holtville, Wellton, Westmorland, Gordon's Well, Algodones Dunes, Kinter, Andrade, Winterhaven, Araby and Blaisdell. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
